stories.text:
My co-founder and I used to be in the fintech space. We used Zendesk to answer customer support tickets. We found a few big shortcomings with Zendesk as we used it: (1) no good secured messaging/PII masker to securely send KYC docs and ensure the info wasn't seen by those that shouldn't; (2) we hated tickets -- they felt transactional and we were running a company that was intended to have super long lifetime value, so a continuous feed would be preferable, and (3) it lacked an effective real-time collaboration interface a la Slack meaning we'd be talking tickets on Slack. We're thinking more deeply now about what would make killer support software, especially for early-stage companies where moving and learning fast are necessary.

What say ye all!?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are you looking for in your ideal customer service platform?
